title: Glen Johnson says Chelsea should be realistic after Eden Hazard's exit and transfer ban
text:
Former Chelsea defender Glen Johnson has urged the club to rein in expectations for this season, and says finishing sixth should be a realistic target for Frank Lampard's men.

The Blues have made a mixed start to the season after losing star midfielder Eden Hazard to Real Madrid for £150million - and a transfer ban by FIFA meant they were unable to replace their former talisman.

Chelsea are banned from signing any players until next summer after an investigation into the signing of foreign players under 18.

Frank Lampard has steadied the ship at Chelsea after a transfer ban and losing Eden Hazard

And Johnson says the double blow means a top-four spot is likely out of reach, telling them to focus on blossoming their youngsters instead.

'The way they can't sign anyone, they lost their best player and can't replace him,' he told TalkSPORT.

'They've got to give kids a chance and some of them have never played in the Premier League before.

'I think sixth would be a good season for them.'

Former Chelsea defender Glen Johnson believes sixth place is a realistic target for the Blues

After a tricky start, things are looking on the up for the Blues - with Tammy Abraham on form

Chelsea got off to a poor start to the campaign when they were thumped 4-0 away at Manchester United on the opening day. But recently they have recovered - picking up three wins and lying seventh in the table, just one point off fourth place.

Young stars such as Mason Mount and Tammy Abraham have particularly impressed, with Mount notching three goals and Abraham putting away seven in seven league games.

'I didn't know Tammy Abraham was capable of this last season. So it's great to see,' Johnson added.

'Maybe there's more out there and if they're given a chance, they'll take it with both hands.'

Chelsea were unable to replace Eden Hazard, who left for Real Madrid in a £150million deal

Johnson played for Chelsea for four years between 2003 and 2007, making 71 appearances for the club.

He won the Premier League and League Cup during his time at Stamford Bridge before moving to Portsmouth.
